name: Verbond van Verzekeraars / Dutch Association of Insurers
goal: The Dutch Association of Insurers represents the interests of private insurance companies operating in the Netherlands. The Association’s members represent more than 95 percent of the insurance market expressed in terms of gross premium income (€ 27 billion, excl. health insurance) and employ over 47.000 people. The Association is an independent organisation managed and financed by its members. The Bureau in The Hague counts 100,7 fte.
interests: Banking and financial services, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: all  EU initiatives directly or partly related to the Insurance sector (monitoring all files re financial sector)
